intro: Centropogon dissectus, commonly known as the dissected centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Its leaves are typically dissected, giving the plant a feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
